overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting using simple averaging to handle daily seasonality. It prioritizes robustness over complexity given the limited historical data (only 4 days), focusing on clear pattern identification, data integrity checks, and step-by-step computation. The method is thoroughly justified with data observations and manual calculations.
common_data_patterns: Absence of missing values in historical data
key_insights: Daily patterns can be captured effectively through hourly averaging when historical cycles are limited
Data inspection for trends and missing values is critical before selecting a forecasting approach
Reshaping data into a matrix (days Ã— hours) simplifies seasonal pattern extraction
Forecast robustness relies on sufficient seasonal cycles (minimal here with only 4 days)
complexity_analysis: Moderately detailed with emphasis on data observation and manual computation, but methodologically simple. Focuses on heuristic-based pattern extraction rather than statistical modeling due to data constraints.
